headline.main: U.S. CITES BROAD SMOKING HEALTH RISK

byline.original: By IRVIN MOLOTSKY, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The Surgeon General of the United States said today that cigarette smoking represented a greater health threat to most American workers than do workplace hazards. In addition, the Surgeon General, Dr. C. Everett Koop, said that cigarette smoking greatly increased the threat to life already faced by workers in hazardous industries, such as those that use asbestos. Studies have established that workers in the asbestos industry have five times more cases of lung cancer than workers in other industries, even if the asbestos workers did not smoke. But when cigarette smoking is added, the report said, the rate is even higher.
